column4: set out entirely to illustrate the method of playing; there is scarcely a battle that will not prove more elaborate (and eventful) than this little encounter. If a number of players and a sufficiently large room can be got
column5: there is no reason why armies of many hundreds of soldiers should not fight over many square yards of model country. So long as each player has about a hundred men and three guns there is no need to lengthen the duration of a game on that account. But it is too laborious and confusing for a single player to handle more than that number of men.Moreover
column6: on a big floor with an extensive country it is possible to begin moving with moves double or treble the length here specified
column7: and to come down to moves of the ordinary lengths when the troops are within fifteen or twelve or ten feet of each other.
